footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Kamisato Ayato | Update Date: 08/23/2022 | Editor: Luno#1337

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Haran Geppaku Futsu, Primordial Jade Cutter__
Ayato’s strongest weapon options that are generally performs similarly overall. Thus, it is not recommended to pull for Haran should player’s have the Primordial Jade Cutter and likewise.

__The Black Sword__
4 star Best-in-Slot weapon with its stat spread and passive being largely beneficial to Ayato’s kit. However, it should be noted that the weapon does not scale all that well with refines, thus purchasing multiple battlepasses to refine the weapon is not advisable.

__Lions Roar__
Obtainable via gacha, Lions Roar is a strong weapon as Ayato’s predominant teams are electrocharge and soup; both of which can keep consistently high uptime on the passive of Lions Roar.
** **

fields.name: Replacement Weapon:
fields.value:
__Mistsplitter’s Reforged__
A minor improvement over Ayato’s 4 star weapon options as he will rarely be able to maintain and utilize its passive to the fullest extent. Although perfectly usable, it is much preferred to use the weapon on other characters who would gain more benefit using the weapon than Ayato would.

__Cursed Blade__
A F2P friendly and decent weapon option should players not have any of the weapons mentioned above.

__Amenoma Kageuchi__
Ayato usually casts his burst at the start of the rotation, rendering the energy gained from the weapon passive near-useless. Thus, players will still need to build the same amount of ER as they did with any other weapon to be able to burst on the subsequent rotations.
** **

**1)** Elemental Skill: Kamisato Art- Kyouka
**2)** Elemental Burst: Kamisato Art- Suiyuu
There is **__No Need__** to level his normal attack talent as his Auto Attacks in his Elemental Skill state has a different set of multipliers based on his **__Elemental Skill.__**

fields.name: Notes:
fields.value:
The difference between Gladiator’s Finale and Heart of Depth comes down to the substat differences and the team buffs present.

A 4 set of Echoes of an Offering should only be considered when ping is consistently below 100, where the artifact set will be accordant with the other options. Otherwise, it is better to farm for 4 Heart of Depth as the artifact passive is essentially unconditional while simultaneously being able to farm for Blizzard Strayer pieces — another common artifact set utilized by many cryo characters.
